content.description: Stand start left hand on a good edge/ pinch on the left side of the face just below the arete, right hand should go on the large arete-like feature out right, both hands are roughly ~6ft at height and are pretty far apart. Pull on with a good slopey toe edge out left and a heel or toe hook low out right. Make a couple hucks to bump your hands up and find a couple crimps and pinches to rock over a right heel hook and top out on the right leaning arete takes you to the top of the boulder.
content.location: This route is on the south side of the boulder, the obvious overhang, and starts with two high hand holds that are relatively far apart, but don't worry there is an alternate start variation that doesn't require a huge wingspan, see the route Shorties Success!

content.description: Start matched on a rail with not much for feet but two fairly good pinches. Pull up and bump to the arete and follow it up and around the corner rocking over a high foot on the large arete like feature on the right side of the overhang.
content.location: This climb starts on the left side of the obvious overhang of this boulder it follows the arete up to the top of the boulder.

content.description: Starts on a crimp rail at 5ish feet high that is just around the corner to the right from the overhang. Make a few bumps up through okay crimpy sidepulls and finish with a long reach to a finish jug straight above the start. Trend up and left from the start hold, if you follow the temptation to go right you'll end up on a vb/v0 variation that is the downclimb. This is definitely not the most stellar line on the boulder but has some good crimps to get warmed up on as well as some interesting movement.
content.location: Stand starts at head height to the right of the obvious overhang on a horizontal two hand crimp rail, then goes up and left out the bulge to a jug rail above a small section of minimally featured mossy slab.

content.description: A boulder with a slightly overhung triangular face with good edges and crimps. There is some potential for climbing on the North side of the boulder, but the South side seemed previously cleaned was in the sun.
